title: Homework
content:
Hurricane In the 2017, Atlantic hurricane season was one of the most destructive hurricane seasons on record.
Lots of people suffered from floods and wind damages caused by hurricane, and we even saw a high number of death toll.
Is this something to do with global warming? Particulate Matter (PM) and seasons It became normal to monitor the air quality before starting the day. The particulate matter (PM) data in the Seoul Metropolitan Area shows an interesting temporal evolution. The PM level has been continuously decreased since 2000 before it starts to go up after 2012. How could we understand and interpret this trend? (Fig. 1 in Kim et al. (2017), Scientific Reports)
